verses.roman:
tam ahaṁ mṛgaye kāntaṁ
pāyayitvādharaṁ madhu
kvāpi yātaḥ spṛhayatīṁ
kṣiptvā māṁ vṛjinārṇave

synonyms: tam—Him; aham—I; mṛgaye—am seeking; kāntam—lover; pāyayitvā—having made drink; ādharam—of His lips; madhu—the honey; kva api—somewhere; yātaḥ—has gone; spṛhayatīm—hankering for Him; kṣiptvā—having thrown; mām—me; vṛjina—of distress; arṇave—in the ocean.
translation: It is that lover I search for. After making me drink the honey of His lips, He has gone elsewhere, and thus He has thrown me, hankering fervently for Him, into the ocean of distress.
